<HEAD>
<TITLE> </TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font size=2><b>Exhibit 10.7</b></font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font SIZE=2>HUNGARIAN TELEPHONE AND CABLE CORP.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font size=2>2002 INCENTIVE STOCK OPTION PLAN (AS AMENDED AND RENAMED ON</font><br><font SIZE=2>MAY 22, 2002)</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>1.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Purpose</font></u><font size=2>. The purpose of the 2002 Incentive Stock Option Plan of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. (the &#147;Corporation&#148;) is to provide incentive to employees of the Corporation, to encourage employee proprietary interest in the Corporation, to encourage employees to remain in the employ of the Corporation, and to attract to the Corporation individuals of experience and ability to serve as employees, directors and consultants.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>2.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Definitions</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Board&#148; shall mean the Board of Directors of the Corporation.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Code&#148; shall mean the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 as amended from time to time.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Common Stock&#148; shall mean the $.001 par value Common stock of the Corporation.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(d)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Committee&#148; shall mean the Committee appointed by the Board in accordance with Section 4 of the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(e)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Corporation&#148; shall mean Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., a Delaware corporation, its parent or any of its subsidiaries.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(f)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Disability&#148; shall mean the condition of an Employee who is unable to engage in any substantial gainful activity by reason of any medically determinable physical or mental impairment which can be expected to result in death or which has lasted or can be expected to last for a continuous period of not less than twelve (12) months.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(g)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Employee&#148; shall mean an individual (who may be an officer or a director) employed by the Corporation (within the meaning of the Code section 3401 and the regulations thereunder).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(h)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Exercise Price&#148; shall mean the price per Share of Common Stock, determined by the Committee, at which an Option may be exercised.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Fair Market Value&#148; of a share of Common Stock on any day shall mean the average of the daily closing prices for the prior twenty (20) trading days of a share of the Company&#146;s Common Stock on the American Stock Exchange, or, if the shares are not listed or admitted to trading on such Exchange, on the principal United States securities exchange or on the NASDAQ/NMS on which the shares are listed or admitted to trading, or if the shares are not listed or admitted to trading on any such exchange or on the NASDAQ/NMS, the mean between the closing high bid and low asked quotations with respect to a share on such dates on the National Association of Securities Dealers, Inc. Automated Quotations System, or any similar system then in use, or if no such quotations are available, the fair
market value on such date of a share as the Committee shall determine.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(j)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Incentive Stock Option&#148; shall mean an Option described in Code section 422(b).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(k)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Nonstatutory Stock Option&#148; or a &#147;Non-Qualified Stock Option&#148; shall mean an Option not described in Code sections 422(b) or 423(b).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(l)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Option&#148; shall mean a stock option granted pursuant to the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(m)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Purchase Price&#148; shall mean the Exercise Price times the number of whole Shares with respect to which an Option is exercised.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(n)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Optionee&#148; shall mean an Employee to whom an option has been granted.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(o)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Plan&#148; shall mean this Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. 2002 Incentive Stock Option Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:left'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(p)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Share&#148; shall mean one Share of Common Stock, adjusted in accordance with Section 10 of the Plan (if applicable).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(q)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>&#147;Subsidiary&#148; shall mean those subsidiaries of the Corporation as defined in section 424(f) of the code.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>3.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Effective Date</font></u><font size=2>. This Plan was approved by the Board and Shareholders effective April 30, 1992 and amended from time to time and renamed on May 22, 2002.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>4.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Administration</font></u><font size=2>. The Plan shall be administered by the Board of Directors or by the Stock Option Committee (the &#145;Committee&#148;) appointed by the Board, consisting of not less than two members thereof. The Board may from time to time remove members from, or add members to, the Committee. Vacancies on the Committee, however caused, shall be filled by the Board.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Committee shall hold meetings at such times and places as it may determine. Acts of a majority of the Committee at which a quorum is present, or acts reduced to or approved in writing by a majority of the members of the Committee, shall be the valid acts of the Committee. The Committee shall from time to time at its discretion make determinations with respect to Employees who shall be granted Options, the number of Shares to be optioned to each and the designation of such Options as Incentive Stock Options or Nonstatutory Stock Options.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The interpretation and construction by the Committee of any provisions of the Plan or of any Option granted thereunder shall be final. No member of the Committee shall be liable for any action or determination made in good faith with respect to the Plan or any Option granted thereunder.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>5.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Eligibility</font></u><font size=2>. Optionees shall be such key Employees (who may be officers, whether or not they are directors), or directors or consultants of the Corporation who perform services of special importance to the management, operation and development of the business of the Corporation as the Committee shall select, but subject to the terms and conditions set forth below.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Each Option shall be designated in the written option agreement as either an Incentive Stock Option or a Non-Qualified Stock Option. However, notwithstanding such designations, to the extent that the aggregate fair market value of the Shares with respect to which Options designated as Incentive Stock Options are exercisable for the first time by any Optionee during any calendar year (under all plans of the Company) exceeds $100,000, such Options shall be treated as Non-Qualified Stock Options.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>For purposes of Section 5(a), Options shall be taken into account in the order in which they were granted, and the fair market value of the Shares shall be determined as of the time the Option with respect to such Shares is granted.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Nothing in the Plan or any Option granted hereunder shall confer upon any Optionee any right with respect to continuation of employment with the Company, nor shall it interfere in any way with the Optionee&#146;s right or the Company&#146;s right to terminate the employment relationship at any time, with or without cause.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>6.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Stock</font></u><font size=2>. The stock subject to Options granted under the Plan shall be Shares of the Corporation&#146;s authorized but unissued or reacquired Common Stock. The aggregate number of Shares which may be issued under Options exercised under this Plan shall not exceed 1,250,000. The number of Shares subject to Options outstanding under the Plan at any time may not exceed the number of Shares remaining available for issuance under the Plan. In the event that any Option outstanding under the Plan expires for any reason or is terminated, the Shares allocable to the unexercised portion of such Option may again be subjected to an Option under the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The limitations established by this Section 6 shall be subject to adjustment upon the occurrence of the events specified and in the manner provided in Section 10 hereof.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>7.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Terms and Conditions of Options</font></u><font size=2>. Options granted pursuant to the Plan shall be evidenced by written agreements in such form as the Committee shall from time to time determine, which agreements shall comply with and be subject to the following terms and conditions:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Date of Grant. Each option shall specify its effective date (the &#147;date of grant&#148;), which shall be the date specified by the Board or the Committee, as the case may be, in its action relating to the grant of the Option.</font></p>
<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2> 2</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Optionee&#146;s Agreement. Each Optionee shall agree to remain in the employ of and to render to the Corporation his or her services for a period of one (1) year from the date of the granting of the Option, but such agreement shall not impose upon the Corporation any obligation to retain the Optionee in their employ for any period.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Number of Shares. Each Option shall state the number of Shares to which it pertains and shall provide for the adjustment thereof in accordance with the provisions of Section 10 hereof.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(d)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Exercise Price and Consideration.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The per Share exercise price under each Option shall be such price as is determined by the Board, subject to the following:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>In the case of an Incentive Stock Option</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>granted to an Employee who, at the time of the grant of such Incentive Stock Option, owns stock representing more than ten percent (10%) of the voting power of all classes of stock of the Company or any Parent or Subsidiary, the per Share exercise price shall be no less than 110% of the fair market value per share on the date of grant.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>ii)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>granted to any other Employee, the per Share exercise price shall be no less than 100% of the fair market value per Share on the date of grant.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>In the case of a Non-Qualified Stock Option the per Share exercise price may be less than, equal to, or greater than the fair market value per Share on the date of grant.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(ii)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The fair market value per Share shall be the average of the daily closing prices for the prior twenty (20) trading days of a share of the Company&#146;s Common Stock on the American Stock Exchange, or, if the shares are not listed or admitted to trading on such Exchange, on the principal United States securities exchange or on the NASDAQ/NMS on which the shares are listed or admitted to trading, or if the shares are not listed or admitted to trading on any such exchange or on the NASDAQ/NMS, the mean between the closing high bid and low asked quotations with respect to a share on such dates on the National Association of Securities Dealers, Inc. Automated Quotations System, or any similar system then in use, or if no such quotations are available, the fair market value on such date of a share as the
Committee shall determine.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(e)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Medium and Time Payment. The Purchase Price shall be payable in full in United States dollars upon the exercise of the Option; provided, however, that, with the consent of the Committee, the Purchase Price may be paid by the surrender of Shares in good form for transfer, owned by the person exercising the option and having a Fair Market Value on the date of exercise equal to the Purchase Price or in any combination of cash and Shares, so long as the total of the cash so paid and the Fair Market Value of the Shares surrendered equals the Purchase Price. No Share shall be issued until full payment therefore has been made.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(f)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Term
  and Exercise of Options; Nontransferability of Options. Each Option shall state
  the time or times when it becomes exercisable. No option shall be exercisable
  after the expiration of ten (10) years from the date it is granted. During the
  lifetime of the Optionee, an Incentive Stock Option shall be exercisable only
  by the Optionee and shall not be assignable or transferable. In the event of
  the Optionee&#146;s death, no Incentive Stock Option shall be transferable by
  the Optionee otherwise than by will or the laws of descent and distribution.
  No Non-Qualified Option granted under the Plan shall be transferable other than
  by will or the laws of descent or distribution except pursuant to a domestic
  relations order as defined by the Internal Revenue Code or Title I of the Employee
  Retirement Income Security Act (&#147;ERISA&#148;) or the rules thereunder and
  except that, with the consent of the Committee acting in its sole discretion,
  an Optionee may transfer (a &#147;Family Member Transfer&#148;) a Non-Qualified
  Option to (i) a member of the Optionee&#146;s immediate family (which for the
  purposes of the Plan shall have the same meaning as defined in Rule 16a-1 promulgated
  under the Securities Exchange Act); (ii) a trust (the &#147;Family Trust&#148;)
  the beneficiaries of which consist exclusively of members of the Optionee&#146;s
  immediate family; and (iii) a partnership, limited partnership or other limited
  liability entity (&#147;Family Entity&#148;) the members of which consist exclusively
  of members of the Optionee&#146;s immediate family or a Family Trust; provided
  that no consideration is paid for the transfer and that each Family Transferee
  execute an instrument agreeing to be bound by the provisions of the Plan and
  the restrictions as to the transferability of the Non-Qualified Option. During
  the lifetime of an Optionee, a Non-Qualified Option</font></p>
<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2> 3</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>
  shall be exercisable only by the Optionee or his or her Family Transferee. A
  (&#147;Family Transferee&#148;) is a transferee that is a Family Trust, Family
  Entity or a member of the immediate family of an Optionee.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(g)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Termination of Employment Except Death. In the event that an Optionee shall cease to be employed by the Corporation for any reason other than his or her death, such Optionee (or permitted Family Transferee in the case of a Non-Qualified Option) shall have the right, subject to the restrictions of Subsection (f) hereof, to exercise the Option at any time within the earlier of (x) the original expiration date of the Option or (y) three (3) months after such termination of employment in the case of an Incentive Stock Option and eighteen (18) months after such termination of employment in the case of a Nonstatutory  or Non-Qualified Stock Option, (twelve (12) months if termination was due to Disability in the case of an Incentive Stock Option), to the extent that, on the day preceding the date of
termination of employment, the Optionee&#146;s right to exercise such Option had accrued pursuant to the terms of the option agreement pursuant to which such Option was granted, and had not previously been exercised.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>For this purpose, the employment relationship will be treated as continuing intact while the Optionee is on military leave, sick leave or other bona fide leave of absence (to be determined in the sole discretion of the Committee, in accordance with rules and regulations construing Code section 422(a)(2)). Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the case of an Incentive Stock Option, employment shall not be deemed to continue beyond the ninetieth (90<sup>th</sup>) day after the Optionee ceased active employment, unless the Optionee&#146;s reemployment rights are guaranteed by statute or by contract.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(h)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Death of Optionee. If the Optionee shall die while in the employ of the Corporation and shall not have fully exercised the Option, an Option may be exercised in full, subject to the restrictions of Subsection (f) hereof, to the extent it had not previously been exercised, at any time within twelve (12) months after the Optionee&#146;s death, by the executors or administrators of his or her estate or by any person or persons who shall have acquired the Option directly from the Optionee by bequest or inheritance or by a permitted Family Transferee (in the case of a Non-Qualified Option).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>If the Optionee shall die following the termination of his employment with the Company and such death shall occur prior to the earlier of (x) the original expiration date of the option or (y) three (3) months following the termination of employment in the case of an Incentive Stock Option, and (18) months following the termination of employment in the case of a Nonstatutory or Non-Qualified Stock Option, and such Option shall not have been fully exercised, an Option may be exercised (subject to the limitations on exercisability set forth in Subsection (f) hereof) to the extent that, at the date of termination of employment, the Optionee&#146;s right to exercise such Option had accrued pursuant to the terms of the applicable option agreement and had not previously been exercised, at any time within twelve (12) months after the Optionee&#146;s death, by the executors or administrators of
the Optionee&#146;s estate or by any person or persons who shall have acquired the Option directly from the Optionee by bequest or inheritance or by a permitted Family Transferee (in the case of a Non-Qualified Option).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Rights as a Stockholder. An Optionee or a permitted transferee of an Optionee shall have no rights as a stockholder with respect to any Shares covered by his or her Option until the date of the issuance of a stock certificate for such shares. No adjustment shall be made for dividends (ordinary or extraordinary, whether in cash, securities or other property) or distributions or other rights for which the record date is prior to the date such stock certificate is issued, except as provided in Section 10.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(j)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Modification, Extension and Renewal of Options. Subject to the terms and conditions and within the limitations of the Plan, the Committee may modify, extend or renew outstanding Options granted under the Plan, or accept the exchange of outstanding Options (to the extent not theretofore exercised and subject to the provisions of paragraph 7(d) above) for the granting of new Options in substitution therefor. Notwithstanding the foregoing, however, no modification of an Option shall, without the consent of the optionee, alter or impair any rights or obligations under any Option theretofore granted under the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(k)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Other
  Provisions. The option agreements authorized under the Plan shall contain such
  other provisions not inconsistent with the terms of the Plan, including, without
  limitation, restrictions upon the exercise of the Option, as the Committee shall
  deem advisable.</font></p>
<p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>4</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'>&nbsp;</p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>8.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Limitation
  on Annual Awards</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>General Rule. Each Option shall be designated in the written option agreement as either an Incentive Stock Option or a Non-Qualified Stock Option. However, notwithstanding such designations, to the extent that the aggregate fair market value of the Shares with respect to which Options designated as Incentive Stock Options are exercisable for the first time by any Optionee during any calendar year (under all plans of the Company) exceeds $100,000, such Options shall be treated as Non-Qualified Stock Options.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>9.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Term of Plan</font></u><font size=2>. Options may be granted pursuant to the Plan until the termination of the Plan on April 30, 2008.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>10.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Recapitalization</font></u><font size=2>. Subject to any required action by the stockholders, the number of Shares covered by this Plan as provided in Section 6, the number of Shares covered by each outstanding Option, and the Exercise Price thereof shall be proportionately adjusted for any increase or decrease in the number of issued Shares resulting from a subdivision or consolidation of Shares, stock split, or the payment of a stock dividend.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Subject to any required action by the stockholders, if the Corporation shall be the surviving corporation in any merger or consolidation, each outstanding Option shall pertain and apply to the securities to which a holder of the number of Shares subject to the Option would have been entitled. A dissolution or liquidation of the Corporation or a merger or consolidation in which the Corporation is not the surviving corporation shall cause each outstanding Option to terminate, unless the agreement of merger or consolidation shall otherwise provide, provided that each Optionee shall in such event, if a period of one (1) year from the date of the grant of the Option shall have elapsed, have the right immediately prior to such dissolution or liquidation, or merger or consolidation in which the Corporation is not the surviving corporation, to exercise the Option in whole or in part, subject to limitations on
exercisability under Section 7(k) hereof.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>In the event of a change in the Common Stock as presently constituted, which is limited to a change of all of its authorized shares with par value into the same number of shares with a different par value or without par value, the shares resulting from any such change shall be deemed to be the Common Stock within the meaning of the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>To the extent that the foregoing adjustments related to stock or securities of the Corporation, such adjustments shall be made by the Committee, whose determination in that respect shall be final, binding and conclusive.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Except as hereinbefore expressly provided in this Section 10, the Optionee shall have no rights by reason of any subdivision or consolidation of shares of stock of any class, stock split, or the payment of any stock dividend or any other increase or decrease in the number of shares of stock of any class or by reason of any dissolution, liquidation, merger, or consolidation or spin-off of assets or stock of another corporation, and any issue by the Corporation of shares of stock of any class or securities convertible into shares of stock of any class, shall not affect, and no adjustment by reason thereof shall be made with respect to, the number or price of Shares subject to the Option.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The grant of an Option pursuant to the Plan shall not affect in any way the right or power of the Corporation to make adjustments, reclassifications, reorganizations or changes of its capital or business structure or to merge or consolidate or to dissolve, liquidate, sell or transfer all or any part of its business or assets.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>11.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Securities Law Requirements</font></u><font size=2>. No Shares shall be issued upon the exercise of any Option unless and until the Corporation has determined that:  (i) it and the Optionee have taken all actions required to register the Shares under the Securities Act of 1933 or perfect an exemption from the registration requirements thereof; (ii) any applicable listing requirement of any stock exchange on which the Common Stock is listed has been satisfied; and (iii) any other applicable provision of state or Federal Law has been satisfied.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>12.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Amendment of the Plan</font></u><font size=2>. The Board may, insofar as permitted by law, from time to time, with respect to any Shares at the time not subject to Options, suspend or discontinue the Plan or revise or amend it in any respect whatsoever except that, without approval of the stockholders, no such revision or amendment shall:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Increase the number of Shares issuable pursuant to the Plan; or</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Change the requirements as to eligibility for participation in the Plan.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Materially
  increase benefits accruing to participants under the Plan.</font><PAGE> </p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>13.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Application of Funds</font></u><font size=2>. The proceeds received by the Corporation from the sale of Common Stock pursuant to the exercise of an Option will be used for general corporate purposes.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>14.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>No Obligation to Exercise Option</font></u><font size=2>. The granting of an Option shall impose no obligation upon the Optionee to exercise such Option.</font></p>
<br>
<p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2> 5</font></p>
<br>


<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;</p>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Exhibit 10.8</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>This Employment Agreement (this &#147;Agreement&#148;) is made and entered into as of March 17, 2003 by and between Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Delaware, United States of America (the &#147;Company&#148;) and Ole Bertram (&#147;Executive&#148;). </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>RECITALS:</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>A.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Executive has been the Company&#146;s President and Chief Executive Officer since January 1, 1999.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>B.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The Company and Executive are parties to that certain Employment Agreement dated May 21, 2001 (the &#147;2001 Employment Agreement&#148;), pursuant to which Executive is serving as the Company&#146;s President and Chief Executive Officer. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>C.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The Company and Executive have agreed to enter into this Agreement to replace the 2001 Employment Agreement. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the respective covenants and agreements of the parties set forth herein, it is agreed as follows:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>1.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Employment and Duties</font></u><font size=2>. The Company agrees to employ Executive and Executive accepts the employment, subject to the terms and conditions herein, to continue to serve as President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company. Executive shall report to the Board of Directors of the Company (the &#147;Board&#148;). Executive&#146;s duties and responsibilities shall include the duties and responsibilities as set forth in the Company&#146;s bylaws from time to time in effect and such other duties and responsibilities as the Board may from time to time reasonably assign Executive, in all cases consistent with Executive&#146;s position. Executive shall perform faithfully the executive duties assigned to him to the best of his ability. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>2.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Place of Employment</font></u><font size=2>. Executive shall be employed at the Company&#146;s offices located in Budapest, Hungary.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>3.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Term</font></u><font size=2>. This agreement shall have an indefinite term and shall continue indefinitely unless terminated pursuant to Section 18 hereof (the &#147;Employment Period&#148;).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>4.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Annual Salary</font></u><font size=2>. Executive is receiving a monthly salary based on an annualized rate of Two Hundred Seventy Thousand Dollars ($270,000) for 2003. The Company shall be entitled to deduct or withhold all taxes and charges which the Company may be required by law to deduct or withhold therefrom. The Compensation - Stock Option Committee of the Board (the &#147;Compensation Committee&#148;) shall annually review (on a calendar year basis) Executive&#146;s base salary in light of the performance of Executive and, if it finds Executive&#146;s performance to be satisfactory, the Compensation Committee shall increase such base salary by an amount it determines to be appropriate.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>5.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Option Award</font></u><font size=2>. Provided Executive has maintained continuous service with the Company through the first business day of each calendar year, the Company shall annually grant to Executive on the first business day of each calendar year, an option from the Company&#146;s 2002 Incentive Stock Option Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;) to purchase at least 100,000 shares of the Company&#146;s common stock. The portion of such option to purchase the first 50,000 shares of common stock shall vest on June 30<sup>th</sup> of the year of grant and the other portion of such option to purchase the remaining 50,000 shares of common stock shall vest on December 31<sup>st</sup> of the year of grant so that such option shall be fully vested within one year of the grant date. Each vesting date is contingent on the
continuous employment of Executive through the relevant vesting date. If Executive has not maintained continuous service with the Company through the relevant vesting date other than in circumstances which would require the payment of Severance Benefits set forth in Paragraph 18(b) and (c) (wherein the Company terminated this Agreement for &#147;cause&#148; or Executive terminated this Agreement upon six months written notice as set forth in Paragraph 18(a)(iii)), all as yet unvested options shall be forfeited and cancelled. The options shall have a ten-year exercise period. The initial purchase price per share of common stock for the options shall be the fair market value per share of the Company&#146;s common stock (as determined by the Plan) on the date of grant. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:left'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>6. </font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>Annual Performance Bonus</font></u><font size=2>. Executive shall be entitled to receive an annual cash bonus if the Company achieves certain pre-determined objectives to be mutually agreed upon by Executive and the Compensation Committee. The Compensation Committee and Executive shall establish such objectives in January of the relevant year and such bonus, if any, shall be payable by April 30<sup>th</sup> of the year following the year in which the bonus is attributable (the &#147;Bonus Year&#148;) after the completion of the Company&#146;s audited financial statements for the Bonus Year, provided that if the Bonus Year is Executive&#146;s last year of employment, then the bonus, if any, shall be payable by December 31<sup>st</sup> of the Bonus Year subject to an agreement between Executive and
the Compensation Committee on a final bonus settlement upon the completion of the audited financial statements for the Bonus Year. For any year in which the Company&#146;s performance reaches at least 75% of such year&#146;s objectives, Executive shall be entitled to receive the following bonus:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<table align=center border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='border-collapse:collapse; '> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>75</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>$75,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>101</font></p> </td>
<td width=66 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>101,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>76</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>76,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>102</font></p> </td>
<td width=66 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%</font></p> </td>
<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>102,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>77</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>77,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>103,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>78</font></p> </td>

<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>78,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>79</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>79,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>105</font></p> </td>
<td width=66 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>105,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>80</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>80,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>106</font></p> </td>

<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>96,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>122</font></p> </td>
<td width=66 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>122,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>97</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>97,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>123</font></p> </td>
<td width=66 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%:</font></p> </td>
<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>123,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>98</font></p> </td>

<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>98,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=108 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>124</font></p> </td>

<td width=92 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>124,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>99</font></p> </td>
<td width=18 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=2>%</font></p> </td>
<td width=105 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:right;'><font size=2>99,000</font></p> </td>
<td width=75 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
