<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Exhibit 10.18</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT</font></b></u></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>This Employment Agreement (this &#147;Agreement&#148;) is made and entered into as of this 1<sup>st</sup> day of August, 2002, by and between Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., a corporation organized under the laws of the State of Delaware, United States of America (the &#147;Company&#148;) and William McGann (&#147;Employee&#148;).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>RECITALS:</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>A.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The Company desires to retain Employee as its Finance Director.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>B.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Employee desires to work for the Company as its Finance Director.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font SIZE=2>C.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The parties desire to set forth the terms and conditions under which Employee shall serve in the above-stated capacity of Finance Director.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the respective covenants and agreements of the parties set forth herein, it is agreed as follows:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>1.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Employment and Duties</font></u><font size=2>. The Company agrees to employ Employee and Employee accepts the employment, subject to the terms and conditions herein, to serve as Finance Director of the Company. Employee&#146;s duties and responsibilities shall include the duties and responsibilities as set forth by the Company, in all cases consistent with Employee&#146;s position. Employee shall perform faithfully the duties assigned to him to the best of his ability.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>2.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Place of Employment</font></u><font size=2>. Employee shall be employed at the Company&#146;s subsidiary offices located in Budapest, Hungary.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>3.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Term</font></u><font size=2>. The term of employment under this Agreement shall commence on July 1, 2002 and continue for an indefinite period of time, unless terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Company shall give six (6) months notice to Employee if it intends to terminate the contract with the employee.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>4.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Salary</font></u><font size=2>. Employee will receive a monthly salary based on an annualized rate of One Hundred and Six Thousand, Five Hundred and Twenty Six US Dollars ($106,526), which will be reviewed on an annual basis, and may be adjusted based upon the performance of the employee. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>5.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Performance Bonus</font></u><font size=2>. Employee shall be eligible to receive a bonus if the Company, in its sole discretion, decides to reward Employee for his performance. Any such bonus shall be paid at the Company&#146;s discretion in either (i) cash, (ii) the Company&#146;s stock, (iii) options to purchase the Company&#146;s stock, (iv) any combination of cash, stock or options, or (v) such other form of consideration as the Company shall determine.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>6.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Housing Allowance</font></u><font size=2>. Employee will receive a monthly housing allowance (the &#147;Housing Allowance&#148;) of Three Thousand US Dollars, ($3,000).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>7.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Employee Taxes</font></u><font size=2>. Employee shall be solely responsible for any and all of Employee&#146;s (i) income and (ii) social security, medicare or any other miscellaneous taxes applicable to any salary, bonus, option grant, stock grant, allowance, severance benefit, or any other type of compensation or benefit received by Employee pursuant to this Agreement which is subject to taxation and payable to any governmental taxing authority including, but not limited to, any governmental taxing authority in the Republic of Hungary or the United States of America.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>8.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Insurance</font></u><font size=2>. Upon request from Employee, the Company will provide Employee, his spouse and his minor dependents with health insurance coverage provided such persons meet any coverage requirements that the Company&#146;s insurance carrier may require.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>9.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Vacation</font></u><font size=2>. Employee will be entitled to 25 Days paid vacation per contract year.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>10.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Automobile</font></u><font size=2>. The company will provide Employee with an automobile for employee&#146;s use during the employment period. The company will insure that the vehicle is properly maintained and insured at all times. Employee will be responsible for fuel costs for private use.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:left'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>11.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Mobile Telephone</font></u><font size=2>. The Company will provide Employee with a mobile telephone during the employment period. Employee will reimburse the Company for all personal telephone calls.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>12.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Work Permits</font></u><font size=2>. With the Company&#146;s assistance, Employee shall obtain and keep current any Hungarian work permits, residency permits or other similar licenses as may be required by Hungarian law as a result of Employee&#146;s employment by the Company.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>13.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Confidential Information</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Nondisclosure</font></u><font size=2>. Employee expressly covenants and agrees that he will not during the term of this Agreement or at any time after the termination hereof, irrespective of the time, manner, or cause of termination, reveal, divulge, disclose, or communicate to any person, firm, or corporation, other than authorized officers, directors, and employees of the Company, in any manner whatsoever, any &#147;confidential information&#148; (as hereinafter defined) of the Company that would be inconsistent with the position held by Employee or the duties being performed by Employee at the direction of the Company.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Return of Confidential Information and Other Property</font></u><font size=2>. Upon termination of this Agreement, Employee will surrender to the Company all confidential information including, without limitation, all lists, charts, schedules, reports, financial statements, books and records, and all copies thereof, of the Company and all other property belonging to the Company whatsoever. As used herein, &#147;confidential information&#148; means information disclosed to or known by Employee as a consequence of or through his employment for the Company, not generally known in the business in which the Company is or may become engaged, about the Company, its business, products and processes.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Breach of Confidentiality Provision</font></u><font size=2>. Employee agrees that a substantial violation on his part of this confidentiality covenant will cause such damage to the Company as will be irreparable and for that reason, Employee further agrees that the Company shall be entitled as a matter of right, to an injunction out of any court of competent jurisdiction, restraining any further violation of said covenant by Employee, his employer, employees, partners, or agents. Such right to injunction shall be cumulative and in addition to whatever other remedies the Company may have, including, specifically, recovery of liquidated and additional damages. Employee expressly acknowledges and agrees that the respective covenants and agreements shall be construed in such a manner as to be enforceable under applicable
laws if a more limited scope of time is determined by a court or competent jurisdiction to be required.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>14.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Termination</font></u><font size=2>.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Reasons for Termination</font></u><font size=2>. The employment of Employee with the Company shall terminate automatically upon Employee&#146;s death and may be terminated by written notice (i) by the Company, upon Employee&#146;s disability which renders him unable to perform his usual and customary duties for a period of 180 consecutive days; (ii) by the Company without &#147;cause&#148; upon 180 days (6 months) notice (as hereinafter defined); (iii) by the Company with &#147;cause&#148; without notice; (iv) by Employee upon 90 days (3 months) notice; (v) by Employee, if he suffers a demotion or a lower status with the Company other than for cause; or (vi) by Employee, in the event of a &#147;change in control&#148; (as hereinafter defined), whether or not Employee suffers a demotion or a lower status with the
Company. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;cause&#148; shall mean (i)&nbsp;a failure by Employee to substantially perform Employee&#146;s reasonable and legal duties and as defined by goals established by the Company and agreed to by Employee, other than a failure resulting from Employee&#146;s complete or partial incapacity due to physical or mental illness or impairment, (ii)&nbsp;a willful act by Employee that constitutes gross misconduct and that is injurious to the Company, (iii)&nbsp;a willful breach by Employee of a material provision of this Agreement, or (iv)&nbsp;a material and willful violation of a federal or state law or regulation applicable to the business of the Company. No act or failure to act, by Employee shall be considered &#147;willful&#148; unless committed without good faith and without a reasonable belief that the act or omission was in the Company&#146;s best interest. For purposes of this Agreement, a &#147;change of control&#148; shall be deemed to have
occurred if (1)&nbsp;any &#147;person&#148; (as such term is used in Sections 13(d) and 14(d) of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Act (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;)), other than (x) Citizens Utilities Company and/or any one or more direct or indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Citizens Utilities Company (together, &#147;Citizens&#148;), or (y) Tele Danmark A/S and/or any one or more direct or indirect wholly-owned subsidiary of Tele Danmark A/S (together, Tele Danmark&#148;), is or becomes the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company </font></p>
<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>- 2 -</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>representing thirty-five percent (35%) or more of the combined voting power (with respect to the election of directors) of the Company&#146;s then outstanding securities;</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(2)&nbsp;at any time after the execution of this Agreement, a majority of the Board shall be replaced, over a two-year period, from the directors who constituted the Board at the beginning of such period, and such replacement shall not have been approved by either two-thirds (<font size=2>2</font><font size=2>/</font><font size=2>3</font>) of the Board as constituted at the beginning of such period or Citizens or Tele Danmark; (3)&nbsp;the consummation of a merger or consolidation of the Company with or into any other corporation (other than with Citizens or Tele Danmark), other than a merger or consolidation which would result in the voting securities of the Company outstanding immediately prior thereto continuing to represent (either by remaining outstanding or by being converted into voting securities of the surviving entity) more than sixty-five percent (65%) of the combined voting power (with respect
to the election of directors) of the securities of the Company or of such surviving entity outstanding immediately after such merger or consolidation; or (4)&nbsp;the consummation of a plan of complete liquidation of the Company or of an agreement for the sale or disposition by the Company of all or substantially all of the Company&#146;s business or assets.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Termination Benefits</font></u><font size=2>. If Employee&#146;s employment is terminated pursuant to Section 14(a) for any reason noted above other than by the Company for &#147;cause&#148; or by Employee upon 90 days notice as set forth in clause (iii) of Section 14(a), Employee will be entitled to receive the following benefits as severance (the &#147;Severance Benefits&#148;):</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.08in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>twelve (12) months&#146; salary, which includes the 180 day notice period, at Employee&#146;s then-current annual salary level, (housing allowance first mentioned at paragraph six (6) above will be considered as part of the employees&#146; salary);</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.08in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(ii)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>payment of any salary, expenses, allowances and benefits accrued by Employee up to the date of the termination; and</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.08in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(iii)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>the immediate vesting and release of any unvested unreleased portion of any options granted as of the date of such termination pursuant to this agreement, without restriction. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Benefits in the Event of Employee&#146;s Death</font></u><font size=2>. Except as set forth below, if Employee&#146;s employment terminates automatically in the event of Employee&#146;s death, Employee&#146;s estate will be entitled to receive the Severance Benefits. The Company may, at its option, maintain a life insurance policy for Employee in an amount deemed to be appropriate by the Board and designating Employee&#146;s estate as the beneficiary. If the Company elects to maintain such life insurance and the policy amount equals or exceeds the value of the Severance Benefits (as determined by the Board), Employee&#146;s estate shall only be entitled to receive the proceeds of the insurance policy. If the policy amount is less than the value of the Severance Benefits, the Company shall pay to Employee&#146;s estate
an amount equal to the difference between the value of the Severance Benefits and the amount to which the estate would be entitled to under the insurance policy. The Company shall determine the value of the Severance Benefits as soon as practicable after Employee&#146;s death but in no event later than thirty (30) days thereafter.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(d)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Date of Termination, Provision of Severance Benefits</font></u><font size=2>. The date of termination of Employee&#146;s employment by the Company under this Paragraph 14 shall be six (6) months after receipt by Employee of written notice of termination, provided, however, that if the termination is for cause the date of termination shall be the date specified in the notice of termination or if no date is specified then the date on which such notice is received by the Employee. The date of termination by Employee under this Paragraph 14 shall be three (3) months after receipt by the Company of written notice of termination. All benefits to which Employee is entitled under subparagraph (b) hereof shall be provided within thirty (30) days of termination. In the case of automatic termination in the event of Employee&#146;s
death, the benefits shall be provided no later than thirty (30) days from the date of Employee&#146;s death.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>15.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>CPE
  Credits</font></u><font size=2>.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The
  Company shall reimburse or pay for Employee to maintain his CPA license, maximum
  Five Thousand US Dollars / year ($5,000).</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'>&nbsp;</p>
<p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>- 3 -</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<br>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>16.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Miscellaneous.</font></u></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Entire Agreement</font></u><font size=2>. Other than with respect to Employees Pension Account, this Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes all prior written and oral and all contemporaneous oral agreements and understandings with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Notices</font></u><font size=2>. Any notice or request to be given hereunder by any party to the other shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given on the next business day after the same is sent, if delivered personally or sent by telecopy or overnight delivery, or five calendar days after the same is sent, if sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, as set forth below, or to such other persons or addresses as may be designated in writing in accordance with the terms hereof by the party to receive such notice.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<table border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='margin-left:77.75pt; border-collapse:collapse'> <tr>
<td width=120 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=2>If to the Company, to:</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=120 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=312 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>Klapka u. Hrsz. 1795/3.</font></p> </td>
<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=120 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=312 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>H-2085 Pilisv&#246;r&#246;sv&#225;r, Hungary</font></p> </td>
<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=120 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=312 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td colspan=3 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>with a required copy to: (to be provided by Employee)</font></p> </td>
<td width=20 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:-.7pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(c)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Governing Law, Forum, Consent to Jurisdiction</font></u><font size=2>. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without giving effect to the principles of conflict of laws thereof. Each of the parties to this Agreement hereby irrevocably and unconditionally (i) consents to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the State of New York for any proceeding arising in connection with this Agreement (and each such party agrees not to commence any such proceeding, except in such courts), (ii) to the extent such party is not a resident of the State of New York, agrees to appoint an agent in the State of New York as such party&#146;s agent for acceptance of legal process in any such proceeding against such party with the same legal force and validity as
if served upon such party personally within the State of New York, and to notify promptly each other party hereto of the name and address of such agent, (iii) waives any objection to the laying of venue of any such proceeding in the courts of the State of New York, and (iv) waives, and agrees not to plead or to make, any claim that any such proceeding brought in any court of the State of New York has been brought in an improper or otherwise inconvenient forum. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(d)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Counterparts</font></u><font size=2>. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, and each of such counterparts shall for all purposes be deemed to be an original, but all such counterparts together shall constitute but one instrument.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(e)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Assignment</font></u><font size=2>. Neither this Agreement, nor the rights and obligations hereunder, may be assigned by either party without the prior written consent of the other party.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(f)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Parties in Interest</font></u><font size=2>. Nothing in this Agreement, expressed or implied, is intended to confer on any person other than the parties hereto or their respective successors or assigns, any rights, remedies, obligations or liabilities under or by reason of this Agreement.</font></p>
<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>- 4 -</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(g)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Amendment</font></u><font size=2>. This Agreement may not be amended except by an instrument in writing signed on behalf of each of the parties.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(h)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Extension, Waiver</font></u><font size=2>. Either party to this Agreement may (a) extend the time for the performance of any of the obligations or other acts of the other party to this Agreement or (b) waive compliance by the other party with any of the agreements or conditions contained herein or any breach thereof. Any agreement on the part of a party to any such extension or waiver shall be valid only if set forth in an instrument in writing signed on behalf of such party.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:1.22in; text-indent:-0.5in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>(i)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><font size=2>Severability</font></u><font size=2>.
  The provisions of this Agreement are severable and, if any provision of this
  Agreement is determined to be invalid or unenforceable by any court of competent
  jurisdiction, such provision (in any other jurisdiction) and the other provisions
  hereof (in any jurisdiction) shall not be rendered otherwise invalid or unenforceable
  and such provision shall be deemed to be modified to the extent necessary to
  render it legal, valid and enforceable, and if no such modification shall render
  it legal, valid and enforceable, then this Agreement shall be construed as if
  not containing the provision held to be invalid, and the rights and obligations
  of the parties shall be construed and enforced accordingly.</font> </p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties have executed this Agreement as of the day and year first above written.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>

statements (No. 333-29885, 333-81813, and 333-54688) on Form S-8 of Hungarian
Telephone and Cable Corp. of our report dated March 13, 2003, relating to the
consolidated balance sheets of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. and
subsidiary as of December 31, 2002 and 2001, and the related consolidated
statements of operations and comprehensive income (loss), stockholders&#146;

period ended December 31, 2002, and the related financial statements Schedules I
and II which report appears in the December 31, 2002 annual report on Form 10-K

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Exhibit 24</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Power of Attorney of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. Director</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned Director of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., a Delaware corporation, which will file with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Washington, D.C., under the provisions of the Securities Law, an Annual Report for 2002 on Form 10-K, hereby constitutes and appoints, William T. McGann and Peter T. Noone his true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them with full power to act without the others, for him and in his name, place and stead, in any and all capacities, to sign said 10-K Annual Report and any and all amendments thereto, and any and all other documents  in connection therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, hereby granting unto said attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them, full power and authority to do and perform any and all acts and things requisite and necessary to be done in and about the premises, as fully to all
intents and purposes as he might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all that said attorneys-in-fact and agents and any of them may lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed this Power of Attorney this 18<sup>th</sup> day of March 18, 2003.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<table align=center border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='margin-left:.4pt;border-collapse: collapse'> <tr>
<td width=306 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><b><font SIZE=2>DARYL A. FERGUSON</font></b></p> </td>

<td width=306 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=14 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=32 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=273 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:left'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p><br><HR noshade align=center width="100%" size=2><p style="page-break-before: always"><PAGE>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Power of Attorney of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. Director</font></b></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>KNOW ALL PERSONS BY THESE PRESENTS, that the undersigned Director of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., a Delaware corporation, which will file with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Washington, D.C., under the provisions of the Securities Law, an Annual Report for 2002 on Form 10-K, hereby constitutes and appoints, William T. McGann and Peter T. Noone his true and lawful attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them with full power to act without the others, for him and in his name, place and stead, in any and all capacities, to sign said 10-K Annual Report and any and all amendments thereto, and any and all other documents  in connection therewith, with the Securities and Exchange Commission, hereby granting unto said attorneys-in-fact and agents, and each of them, full power and authority to do and perform any and all acts and things requisite and necessary to be done in and about the premises, as fully to all
intents and purposes as he might or could do in person, hereby ratifying and confirming all that said attorneys-in-fact and agents and any of them may lawfully do or cause to be done by virtue hereof.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the undersigned has executed this Power of Attorney this 18<sup>th</sup> day of March 18, 2003.</font></p>

<BODY bgcolor="#ffffff">
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font size=2>Exhibit 99.1</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font size=2>Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><font size=2>Certifications of Chief Executive Officer and Principal Financial Officer</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>I, Ole Bertram, President and Chief Executive Officer of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., certify, pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>To
  the best of my knowledge and belief, based upon a review of this year end report
  on Form&nbsp;10-K of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. for the year ended
  December 31, 2002, and, except as corrected or supplemented in a subsequent
  report:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2><b><font size=2>&#149;</font></b></font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>this annual report of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December 31, 2002 which this statement accompanies fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2><b><font size=2>&#149;</font></b></font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>the information contained in this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. for the year ended December 31, 2002 fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. </font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<table align=center border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='border-collapse:collapse; '> <tr>
<td width=307 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=46 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td colspan=2 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>
<td width=307 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><br > <br > </p> </td>
<td width=46 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=25 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=2>By:&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=248 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><br> <font size=2>/s/ Ole Bertram</font></p> </td> </tr> <tr>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; text-indent:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>I, William T. McGann, Controller and Treasurer of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp., certify, pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>To the best of my knowledge and belief, based upon a review of this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. for the year ended December 31, 2002, and, except as corrected or supplemented in a subsequent report:</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2><b><font size=2>&#149;</font></b></font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>this annual report of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December 31, 2002 which this statement accompanies fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2><b><font size=2>&#149;</font></b></font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>the information contained in this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. for the year ended December 31, 2002 fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of Hungarian Telephone and Cable Corp. </font></p>
